article.headline: Arizona St. 76, Oregon 57
article.story: EUGENE, Ore. -- Rihards Kuksiks scored 25 points, and Arizona State buried Oregon with eight 3-pointers in the first half to win 76-57 on Thursday night. Ty Abbott scored 16 points -- all in the first half -- and Derek Glasser added 12 for the Sun Devils (13-5, 3-2 Pac-10). Kuksiks and Abbott had four 3-pointers each, and Arizona State made 10 of 20 shots from beyond the arc. LeKendric Longmire scored 11 points to lead the Ducks (10-6, 2-2), who became the latest victim of a smothering Sun Devils defense that came into the game with a nation-leading 54.4 points-allowed average. Though Oregon surpassed that total, it shot just 37 percent (22 of 59) from the floor and 29 percent (4 of 14) from 3-point range. The Ducks finished 20 points under their season average.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
